Module cathedral.game
Package de.fhkiel.ki.cathedral.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
de.fhkiel.ki.cathedral.game.Game
public class Game extends Object
Core class used to handle a full game of cathedral. The Game class is the core of this framework. It stores and handles all interactions and keeps track of all players and the rules pertaining them.These rules can be toggled with ignoreRules(boolean).
Example usage: 
     // Instantiate the game
     Game game = new Game();
     // print the empty game to the console
     System.out.println(game);

     // Place the cathedral
     // create the placement
     Placement cathedral = new Placement(3, 3, Direction._0, Building.Blue_Cathedral);
     // make the placement
     game.takeTurn(cathedral);
     // print the game to the console
     System.out.println(game);

     // Place the black academy
     // create the placement
     Placement blackAcademy = new Placement(8, 3, Direction._270, Building.Black_Academy);
     // make the placement
     game.takeTurn(blackAcademy);
     // print the game to the console
     System.out.println(game);
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Instantiates a new Game with all needed settings and an empty Board.

    • Game

      public Game​(Board starter)
      Instantiates a new Game with default settings and the given Board.
      Parameters:
      starter - the starting Board

  • Method Details

    • copy

      public Game copy()
      Deep copy of the full game (EXPENSIVE).
      Returns:
      the new game-copy

    • takeTurn

      public boolean takeTurn​(Placement placement)
      Make a Placement on the current Board. The placement has to be valid and, if the rules are not ignored (ignoreRules(boolean)), from the current player Color
      Parameters:
      placement - the Placement to be made
      Returns:
      if the Placement could be successfully placed on the current Board

    • takeTurn

      public boolean takeTurn​(Placement placement, boolean fast)
      Make a Placement on the current Board. The placement has to be valid and, if the rules are not ignored (ignoreRules(boolean)), from the current player Color.
      Parameters:
      placement - the Placement to be made
      fast - if expensive region-computations should be skipped (can lead to wrong boardstates)
      Returns:
      if the Placement could be successfully placed on the current Board

    • lastTurn

      public Turn lastTurn()
      Gets the last Turn. If no turn has been taken, a turn with the starting Board and no Turn.getAction() will be returned.
      Returns:
      the last Turn

    • undoLastTurn

      public void undoLastTurn()
      Undo last the last turn. All changes will be reverted. Can be used to get back to the starting Board.

    • forfeitTurn

      public void forfeitTurn()
      Forfeit the current turn. An no action Turn will be taken and the next player will be able to play.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Color getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the current player Color. Can be the Color.Blue, Color.Black or Color.White
      Returns:
      the current player Color

    • getPlacableBuildings

      public List<Building> getPlacableBuildings()
      Gets a list of unplaced Buildings for the current player. if rules are ignored (ignoreRules(boolean) all unplaced buildings are returned.
      Returns:
      the list of unplaced Buildings

    • getPlacableBuildings

      public List<Building> getPlacableBuildings​(Color player)
      Gets a list of unplaced Buildings for the player Color.
      Parameters:
      player - the Color of the player
      Returns:
      the list of unplaced Buildings

    • getAllUnplacedBuildings

      public List<Building> getAllUnplacedBuildings()
      Gets all currently unplaced Buildings in a list. There are no numbers for Buildings. The buildings can be all Colors.
      Returns:
      a list of all currently unplaced Buildings

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Gets the current Board. It is equivalent with the Board of the last turn.
      Returns:
      the current board

    • score

      public Map<Color,​Integer> score()
      The score contained in a map. There are always scores for the Color.Black and the Color.White contained.
      They range from 47 to 0 and show the aggregate of all unplaced buildings of the chosen color.
      Returns:
      the map with the score for Color.Black and Color.White

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Is the game finished. A game is finished if no Buildings can be placed.
      Returns:
      true if no buildings can be placed, false otherwise

    • ignoreRules

      public void ignoreRules​(boolean ignoreRules)
      Enables or disables checks witch player can place stones If set to true any building can be placed anytime. It still has to be a valid position.
      Parameters:
      ignoreRules - should certain rules be ignored

    • ignoreRules

      public boolean ignoreRules()
      Returns if certain rules can be ignored If set to true any building can be placed anytime. It still has to be a valid position.
      Returns:
      returns if rules are being ignored
